issues.description: The problem specification declares a public method checkOrderReady() in SealSaloon, but the solution implements this logic in a method named processOrders() and omits checkOrderReady(), causing a signature mismatch with the expected API.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename processOrders() to checkOrderReady(), or add a public void checkOrderReady() method that delegates to processOrders(), so the class matches the specified API.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method named checkOrderReady() for serving pending orders, but the solution implementation defines and invokes a method named processOrders() instead. This mismatch in method names can confuse students when they try to map the requirement (checkOrderReady) to the reference implementation (processOrders).
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution’s processOrders() method to checkOrderReady() (and update its invocation in orderMeal) to align with the problem statement.
